cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 135 miles SE of Biloxi, Mississippi
cyclone.trajectory: Turning north then northeast, tracking slowly toward the north-central Gulf Coast (southeast Louisiana, Mississippi and the western Florida Panhandle).

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch/Warning from Port Fourchon LA to the Okaloosa/Walton County Line FL; Hurricane Watch area west of Morgan City LA (none of these include Tampa).
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Morgan City LA to Navarre FL; Tropical Storm Warning Navarre FL to Indian Pass FL.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-central Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana eastward to the western Florida Panhandle.
weather_observation.wind: Occasional breezy conditions; chance of tropical-storm-force winds ≤4%.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–3 ft possible along the west-central Florida coast, including Tampa Bay.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands could bring 1–3 inches of rain and brief downpours.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Increased rip-current risk and a low (but non-zero) tornado threat in outer bands.
